recipes.startdescription: SOLDIER - YOU HAVE NOT INSTALLED AND/OR ENABLED THE ROOST! THIS MOD WILL NOT FUNCTION PROPERLY!

recipes.label: A Moment of Reprieve?
recipes.startdescription: Snow dusts the earth as I trudge towards our perimeter. The men I command - weary, fierce, loyal - salute as I pass. All these men are my brothers, yes, but precious few of them I would call friend. At camp's edge, however, stands a fresh friend, waiting for me.
recipes.description: 'Hello,' they say to me, holding something out between their fingers. 'Cigarette?'

recipes.label: Words from a Friend
recipes.startdescription: My friend and I discuss the war: the dead, the victorious, and us. 'Your men have kept steady since the previous engagement - you lead well,' they say. There are embers of warmth in their voice. Cigarette smoke rolls over the landscape as we each exhale.

recipes.label: Farewell?
recipes.startdescription: My friend grinds out their cigarette beneath their heel. 'This has been a refreshing affair. But I will be leaving, I think. My Foe's trajectory no longer intersects with yours, and I must keep my appointment with him,' they inform me. 'Before I depart, I would like to bestow upon you two things: my respect, and a secret.'
recipes.description: 'Many things have transpired to make this war a reality. The Edge Hours hold sacred contest here, and the prize is great, indeed: a Name. I have told you of Names. Once the dust is settled, there will be opportunity for one to be appointed. The Colonel would see that it is his. My Foe and I share a noble station; neither of us wish to be Named so. But someone must be, and I would wager that is you.'

recipes.label: A Soldier's Talents
recipes.startdescription: My friend is gone in the morning, as they had promised. Their memory lingers. I recall things: who they were, how they fought, what they taught to me between drinks in the foxhole and in the blood of our enemies.
recipes.description: War drives many, but few drive war. My friend was one of those few. I fought at their side and in their shadow; I trusted them and I, in turn, was trusted. This knifepoint of secret technique is one of their gifts to me, and I intend to use it.

recipes.label: The Flesh, the Blood, the Bone
Onwards
recipes.startdescription: New marching orders from command. The Germans are on the move, and so we must be, too.
